title: What is the oldest tree in the world in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Great Basin bristlecone pine *With its date finally confirmed in 2012, there is one other Great Basin bristlecone pine that's actually older (5,068 years old as of 2020—born around the time of the invention of the wheel), but the exact location of this healthy, unnamed specimen has been kept secret. *This Great basin bristlecone pine is believed to be the oldest individual tree in the world. It was named the oldest tree in 2012, beating the previous record holder by over 200 years. ***Pando : Pando is the oldest tree in the world as well as one of the oldest living organisms. While most of the other trees on this list are individuals, Pando is a clonal colony that shares one underground root systems. Above ground, Pando may look like a grove of individual trees, but they are all genetically identical clones. Age: ~80,000 years Species: Quaking Aspen (Populus tremuloides) Location: Fishlake National Forest, Utah, USA Hope it's helpful for you) :—————

The oldest individual tree in the world os Methuselah, a 4,845-year-old Great Basin bristlecone pine (Pinus longaeva) in the White Mountains of California. Researchers at the Rocky Mountain tree ring research group verified the same .
